direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash code generation, ensuring consistency in object identity and equality checks.
Both methods involve operations on the internal state of the ComparatorChain, with compare focusing on comparison logic and hashCode on generating a hash code.
Both methods handle the state of the ComparatorChain, with checkLocked managing exceptions related to state modifications.
Both methods modify the internal state of the ComparatorChain, with addComparator adding comparators and hashCode generating a hash code based on the current state.
Both methods modify the internal state of the ComparatorChain, with setComparator replacing comparators and hashCode generating a hash code based on the current state.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the ComparatorChain is necessary before generating a hash code.
Ensuring the ComparatorChain is locked before generating a hash code is crucial to maintain state consistency.
The equals method can be used to verify that the hash code generation is consistent with object equality.
